data.title: Cool city names for babies
data.meta_description: Choosing a city baby name means that the world is your oyster! Here are the best city baby girl names & our favourite city baby boy names...
data.text:
City-Inspired Baby Girl Names

Acadia

Acadia is the French name for Nova Scotia and aptly means ‘idyllic place.’

Adana

Adana is a large city in Turkey. The name Adana means ‘earth.’

Adelaide

Did you know that this Australian city was named in honour of Queen Adelaide, the wife of King William IV? Coincidentally, the name Adelaide means ‘noble.’

Alba

Alba is located in Italy and means ‘white.’

Alberta

Alberta is a traditional girl’s name inspired by the Canadian prairie province. The name Alberta means ‘noble’ and ‘bright.’

Alexandria

The Egyptian city of Alexandria was once the largest in the world. The girl’s name Alexandria is of Greek origin and means ‘defender of mankind.’

Amaya

This name of Spanish origin is derived from the ancient Spanish city, but is also a city in Texas. Coincidentally, in Japanese the name Amaya means ‘mother city.’

Antalya

Antalya is a Turkish city and is also a girl’s name of Greek origin meaning ‘break of day.’

Arta

Arta is a Greek city, but its use as a name is believed to have Albanian origins and means ‘golden.’

Atlanta

Atlanta is the largest city in the American state of Georgia and is a girl’s name meaning ‘unswaying’ and ‘immovable.’

Aurora

Aurora is a city in Colorado and a really cute name for a baby girl. As a name Aurora means ‘dawn.’

Cali

Cali is a city in Colombia and a pretty name for a baby girl.

Chelsea

Technically not a city, but this London borough is nonetheless a perfect girl’s name.

Dakota

Dakota City is located in Nebraska, and Dakota is also a great choice of name for a baby girl, think American actress Dakota Johnson.

Delphi

Delphi means ‘hollow’ and is also the name of a city in Ancient Greece.

Edessa

Edessa is a city in Greece. When used as a given name this pretty moniker means ‘from Edessa.’

Florence

This Italian city is a super sweet girl’s name and means ‘flourishing.’

Geneva

The name of this Swiss city is also a French girl’s name meaning ‘juniper tree.’

Havana

This Cuban city makes for a unique name for a baby girl.

Helena

Helena means ‘shining light’ and is also the name of a city in Montana, United States.

Larissa

Larissa means ‘cheerful’ and is a Greek city.

Lille

Lille is a city in Northern France, but also has plenty of potential as a pretty girl’s name.

Lourdes

Take inspiration from Madonna and name your little one Lourdes after the pilgrimage site in France.

Nara

Nara may be a Japanese city, but it is also a girl’s name of Celtic origin meaning ‘happy.’

Odessa

Odessa is a Ukrainian city and also a girl’s name of Greek origin meaning ‘long journey.’

Olympia

This Greek name means ‘mountain of the Gods.’

Regina

Regina is a city in Canada and also a Latin name meaning ‘queen.’

Roma

Take inspiration from the Italian capital city with the name Roma.

Rosario

Rosario is one of the largest cities in Argentina. Rosario is used as a baby girl’s name in Spanish-speaking countries and means ‘rosary.’

Roseau

Roseau is the capital city of Dominica. When used as a name it is believed that Roseau originates from the word ‘red.’

Savannah

Savannah is a city in the US state of Georgia and also a great name for a baby girl meaning ‘large open plain.’

Serena

Serena means ‘serene’ and is inspired by the Chilean city of La Serena.

Shannon

Shannon is inspired by the Irish place name and means ‘old river.’

Shiloh

Shiloh is the name of an ancient city in Israel. The name Shiloh means ‘heavenly peace.’

Sicily

The name Sicily is inspired by the Italian place name and literally means ‘from Sicily.’

Siena

Siena is an Italian city and when used as a name means ‘from Siena’ and ‘orange-red.’

Sierra

Sierra City is located in California, and is also a Spanish name meaning ‘saw’ and ‘from the mountains.’

Sofia

Sofia is the name of a Bulgarian city, and a popular name choice in the UK.

Sydney

As well as being a vibrant Australian city, Sydney is also a popular name choice which is derived from old English and means ‘wide meadow.’

Taylor

Taylor is a city in Michigan, United States and when used as a name means ‘tailor’ or ‘cutter of cloth.’

Valetta

Valetta is the capital city of Malta and could make for a cute-sounding baby girl name.

Verona

Verona may be a place in Italy, but it is also a name meaning ‘truth.’

Victoria

Victoria is both an Australian state and a Canadian city, but also a popular girl’s name meaning ‘victory.’

Vienna

Vienna may be best-known as the capital city of Austria, but it could also make a great baby girl name. Vienna means ‘forest stream.’

Xanthi

Xanthi is a city in Greece and when used as a given name means ‘golden’ and ‘yellow.’

Zaria

Zaria is a major Nigerian city and makes for a perfect name choice, as it means ‘princess.’

City-Inspired Baby Boy Names

Albany

Albany is the capital city of New York State and means ‘white’ and ‘fair.’

Alden

The name Alden is inspired by another New York place name. The name Alden means ‘old friend.’

Aspen

Aspen is inspired by the city in Colorado, known as a world-famous ski resort. Aspen means ‘quaking tree.’

Austin

This Texan city is a popular name meaning ‘great.’

Bailey

Another Texan city inspired baby name is Bailey, meaning ‘bailiff’ or ‘fortification.’

Bay

Bay City is located in Michigan in the United States. The name Bay means ‘berry.’

Brooklyn

Brooklyn is another American place name to inspire a boy’s name, and the chosen moniker for the Beckham’s eldest son.

Cairo

This name is inspired by Egypt’s capital, and means ‘victorious.’

Chandler

Friends fans will love the name Chandler, which is a city in Arizona, United States and means ‘candle maker.’

Chester

This UK city is a super cute baby boy’s name and was chosen by Holly Willoughby and Davina McCall for their sons.

Chicago

Take inspiration from Kim Kardashian and Kanye West with the name Chicago.

Cody

Cody is both the name of a US city and popular boy’s name meaning ‘helpful.’

Cruz

Cruz is a name inspired by the Argentinian city, Santa Cruz and means ‘cross.’

Dallas

This Texan city is a strong boy’s name with Irish origins meaning ‘skilled.’

Dayton

Dayton is another of the popular American city names for boys and means ‘day town’ or ‘light town.’

Denver

Denver is Colorado’s largest city. When used as a name, Denver has two meanings; ‘green valley’ and ‘from Anvers.’

Diego

This name takes inspiration from San Diego and means ‘supplanter.’

Eugene

Did you know that Eugene is a city in Oregon? This popular name means ‘well born.’

Francisco

Francisco is a strong name inspired by San Francisco and means ‘Frenchman.’

Hamilton

Hamilton is a city in Canada and makes for a great city-inspired name for a baby boy. Hamilton means ‘flat-topped hill’ or ‘treeless hill.’

Indiana

Whether you love that Indiana is an American city, or you are inspired by Indiana Jones, there is no doubt that this is a cool boy’s name.

Jackson

The name Jackson means ‘Jack’s son,’ and is a city in Mississippi.

Kingston

This Jamaican city was chosen by Gwen Stefani and Gavin Rossdale for their son and means ‘king’s town.’

Kobe

Kobe is a Japanese city, and is also an increasingly popular name used mainly for baby boys.

Lawrence

Lawrence is a name derived from the ancient city of Laurentum and means ‘from Laurentum.’

Leon

León is a Spanish city as well as a popular name for boys and means ‘lion.’

Lincoln

If you are looking for a British city name for your little one Lincoln is a great choice. Lincoln means ‘settlement by the pool.’

Logan

Logan is an Australian city located close to Brisbane. When used as a boy's name Logan means ‘little hollow.’

Luca

Luca or Lucca is inspired by a city in the Tuscany region of Italy. The name Luca means ‘bringer of light.’

Macon

This strong name is a city in France, and means ‘marsh dweller.’

Mason

Mason is a popular name for boys and also a city in Ohio. Mason means ‘one who works with stone.’

Milan

If you want a sophisticated city name for your son, Milan is a perfect option. Milan means ‘favour’ and ‘grace.’

Orlando

Orlando means ‘famous’ making it the perfect name for a budding superstar.

Osaka

Osaka is a distinctive name for a baby boy and is inspired by the Japanese city.

Paris

Paris continues to be one of the most popular city names for both boys and girls.

Peyton

Peyton is one of the more unusual city-inspired baby names, but an excellent choice if you like something a little different. The name Peyton means ‘fighting man’s estate.’

Phoenix

Phoenix is a strong name with an equally strong meaning of ‘reborn from the ashes.’

Rio

Rio is a name of Spanish origin and means ‘river.’

Salvador

The name Salvador is inspired by San Salvador, which is the capital of the Central American country El Salvador. Salvador means ‘saviour.’

Santiago

Santiago is the capital city of Chile. The name Santiago means ‘supplanter.’

Sebastian

San Sebastian is a city in Puerto Rico. The name Sebastian means ‘revered’ or ‘venerable.’

Trenton

Trenton is located in New Jersey and a great name for a baby boy. Trenton originates from England and means ‘from the town by the River Trent.’

Troy

Troy takes inspiration from the city in Ancient Greece. The name Troy means ‘foot soldier.’

York

This English city could be the perfect choice of name for your baby, especially if you have connections with the area. The name York means ‘the town of the wild boar.’
